intro: Roettlera macrosiphon, commonly known as the broad-leaved roettlera, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, dark blue to black berries that are edible but not commonly consumed by humans. Roettlera macrosiphon is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
